attributes.action: Reform use of non-disclosure agreements (NDAs) in employment
attributes.background: Settlements that include NDAs remain secret. This can perpetuate a culture of bullying and victimisation and allow abuse to remain unchallenged. All NDAs should explicitly say that employees or ex-employees are allowed to talk about any bullying and harassment they might have seen or experienced.
attributes.additional_details: The opposite view, that payments routinely reward false allegations, also leads to the same conclusion. These NDAs are inappropriate.

attributes.action: Make all new school buses zero-emission vehicles from 2020.
attributes.background: Over a million children in the UK use school transport provided by transit buses, contracted coaches, minibuses and taxis each day. We’re asking the government to ensure the vehicles carrying our children to school don’t add to the already harmful levels of air pollution.
attributes.additional_details:
Air quality in the UK has been described as a public health emergency contributing to 40,000 premature deaths per year and it's small children who are affected the most. Electric school bus motors
produce zero emissions. This means cleaner, healthier air while
kids wait to board the bus & inside the cabin.

attributes.action: Remove “positive action for recruitment and promotion” from the Equality Act
attributes.background: Under the Equality Act, an employer can use "positive action" to promote or recruit a candidate from a certain group with a protected characteristic deemed to be under-represented in the work force if they are considered "as qualified as" another candidate who isn't from that group.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that this is not positive but unethical and discriminatory. A law supposed to prevent discrimination encourages it, particularly when it comes to employment. Nobody should be at an advantage and nobody should be at a disadvantage due to their ethnicity or any other factor they have no control over. I want the positive action exemption for recruitment and promotion to be removed from the Equality Act.

attributes.action: Repeal Welfare Reform Act 2012 and ban outright zero hours contracts
attributes.background: The Welfare Reform Act 2012 and zero hours contracts are causing huge levels of social deprivation and poverty impacting significantly on disabled and vulnerable people which must be stopped.

attributes.action: Introduce official national ID cards or make PASS cards part of the law
attributes.background: Many people lose their IDs such as driving license which is difficult and costly to replace.PASS hologram cards supposedly should fix this problem but until this day not every place recognises this type of identification.We need the government to introduce something that would be recognisable fully
attributes.additional_details: PASS hologram cards don’t work everywhere from my experience as many places like nightclubs are not even aware of them and usually they reject people that have them. What is the point for the government to support a scheme that is not effective. We need a government issued national ID or make PASS hologram cards part of official identification here in England in order to solve this problem as carrying driving licences or passports is a big risk to take and a long process to replace

attributes.action: UK Gov to negotiate with EU possible retainment of EU Citizenship
attributes.background: People born in the UK after it joined the EEC in 1973 are not only born with automatic British citizenship but also with EU citizenship and should be allowed to keep that citizenship (in an opt-out style scheme) regardless of whether the UK leaves the bloc or not.
attributes.additional_details:
A briefing paper from the House of Commons Library titled 'Brexit & EU Citizenship' questions whether EU citizenship can be lost.

Clauses within EU law define an individuals citizenship status but it has been noted that citizenship cannot simply be taken away through a majority decision, especially against the will of the individual. The only way in which citizenship would cease to exist is if the EU itself were to dissolve.

attributes.action: Prevent ratification of intl trade deals that allow the UK to be sued under ISDS
attributes.background: ISDS clauses allow investors to sue the government for any measures that harm their profits. Stop the ratification of trade deals that include ISDS clauses.
attributes.additional_details:
We are in a critically defining period of the UKs future. One that will be led by Trade Deals being written, negotiated and agreed right now, if Brexit goes ahead.

In this process Liam Fox MP has allowed ISDS clauses to be included in future International Trade Agreements. These will allow investors to sue the UK government for any measures that harm their profits. The future ramifications of this are incalculably bad for the prosperity of the UK.

This petition seeks to stop the UK Government ratifying trade deals that include ISDS clauses that would allow the UK to be sued.

attributes.action: Reform Lasting Powers of Attorney
attributes.background:
I was excluded from the decision-making process in my mother's welfare because I was not a named Power of Attorney.
I have personal and work experience of the problems in the system
attributes.additional_details: I would like a hotline set up, whereby concerned professionals, relatives and friends can report any incidents where they feel a donor is being heavily persuaded to set up a particular Power of Attorney. I would like to see donors sign some sort of disclaimer in which they confirm that they understand the repercussions a Power of Attorney can have on any relative or friend who has not been named. I would like to see further training for care organisations and health professionals so that everyone is aware of the rules around Power of Attorney.

attributes.action: To Change ISP +TV leaving conditions it be in line with changing Banks/Gas/Elec
attributes.background:
People change their Banks, Gas/Electric suppliers daily and without any problems and without incurring any penalty. 
However as soon as you want to change you TV/Internet/Phone provider you get hit with projected costs of the service the provider may loose. This can’t be right. It’s very wrong

attributes.action: Allow GPs to prescribe medical marijuana for long term chronic pain conditions
attributes.background: As a person suffering from long term chronic pain, there’s little help from the medical professionals, who just write scripts for antidepressants and risky opioids! We chronic pain warriors are not junkies, Please help us get access to this new pain relief, so we can live again. Thanks

attributes.action: Routinely test pregnant women for Group B Strep
attributes.background: Staphylococcus aureus and Group B Streptococcus are common infections. However, in rare cases they can be fatal for the unborn baby, and for up until 12 weeks after a baby is born if they develop a late onset of symptoms. Both of these infections are easily treated by antibiotics.
attributes.additional_details: Antibiotics are given during the mother’s labour and antibiotics are given to baby once born. These infections are easily picked up by a swab and are easily treated also. This should be a routine test that ALL pregnant women should be able to get during pregnancy to ensure the health and safety of both mum and baby.

attributes.action: Completely divest from fossil fuels and end fossil fuel subsidies
attributes.background: With overwhelming evidence that global warming is human-caused and posing a significant threat to the lives of millions, the UK government must lead the world in ending investment and subsidies for the fossil fuel industry.
attributes.additional_details:
Some articles on the subject:
https://www.ft.com/content/318f85c8-85ea-11e8-96dd-fa565ec55929
https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2018/jan/10/new-york-city-plans-to-divest-5bn-from-fossil-fuels-and-sue-oil-companies
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2019/jan/23/uk-has-biggest-fossil-fuel-subsidies-in-the-eu-finds-commission
https://climate.nasa.gov/evidence/

attributes.action: Introduce Mandatory Random Drug Testing for ALL UK Police on a quarterly basis.
attributes.background: The police should be subject to random drug testing at least every quarter.

attributes.action: UK government to urge the Japanese government to stop the mutilation of dolphins
attributes.background: The Japanese fishermen cut the fins of dolphins that they catch in their nets and then release them back into the sea to die a slow and agonising death

attributes.action: Free up empty MOD housing stock to homeless ex services staff .
attributes.background:
MOD homes standing empty across UK. 
More than 11,000 Ministry of Defence homes across the UK are empty, costing the taxpayer more than £25m a year in rent and maintenance.
These homes could be used to accommodate homeless ex service staff.

attributes.action: Urge India and Pakistan to create an independent state in Kashmir
attributes.background: Urge India and Pakistan to create an independent state in Indian-Occupied Kashmir. Anti-India protests and clashes erupted in Indian-occupied Kashmir on Saturday after a gun battle between militants and government forces killed rebels, police and residents.
attributes.additional_details: India and Pakistan each claim the divided territory of Kashmir in its entirety. Rebels have been fighting Indian control since 1989. Many Kashmiris support the rebel cause that the territory be united either under Pakistani rule or as an independent country. India accuses Pakistan of arming and training the rebels, a charge Pakistan denies. Nearly 70,000 people have been killed in the uprising and the ensuing Indian military crackdown.

attributes.action: Make landlords of privately owned student property liable for council tax
attributes.background: In the last 10 years, as the uni near my home has grown, landlords have bought and extended many properties in the area and let them to students, who all use the services provided by the council.   No one is paying for their  use of local council services eg rubbish collection.
attributes.additional_details: Many of the properties, 3 bed family homes with average sized families, have been extended so there are 8-10 students in some. They require extra refuse bins, extra demand on health services and extra policing. Landlords are earning a minimum of £120 per room per week so can afford and should be paying for the extra services the student population uses. The extra revenue would help to pay for local health and social care costs.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of non-biodegradable cigarette filters in the UK.
attributes.background: Cigarette butts are the most common form of man-made litter in the world. It is estimated that 4.5 trillion cigarette butts become litter every year. The fibres used as the predominant filter material do not readily biodegrade. A normal lifespan of a discarded filter is thought to be up to 15 years!
attributes.additional_details: Banning the sale of certain materials is an effective way to force manufacturers to create alternatives. Fines have not stopped individuals from littering (just look at the floor on your own high-street!). Manufacturers won't change from cheaper, more environmentally damaging materials unless their hand is forced. So, let's force their hands!

attributes.action: Remove the 16-25 railcard minimum fare on trains before 10am
attributes.background: National Rail has a ban on using railcard discounts before 10 am due to the minimum train fare restriction between 4:30 am and 10 am of £12 which students and workers can't afford to pay everyday.

attributes.action: Make online retailers disclose the courier company that they use on website
attributes.background: With a varying degree of service provided by differing courier companies and not knowing which company will be (or not) delivering your goods, it should be compulsory for all online retailers to disclose which company they are using, prior to checkout on the website.
attributes.additional_details: Knowing which courier company has been engaged stops the lottery of will they or won't they deliver. In rural areas we know which companies are reliable and which ones don't bother at all, however, when we order we are then subject to the lottery of will goods turn up or not. This will ensure that we can have an informed choice as to whether to proceed with the purchase or not before committing to it.

attributes.action: Ban Recruitment companies charging a percentage of your wages to process them.
attributes.background: Some recruitment agencies charge a Fee for processing your wages.  They pay your wages to a third party company who processes them and pays the remainder minus 10-20% into your bank.
attributes.additional_details:
My Partner worked for a recruitment agency, they got him to sign a contract with a third party agreeing to the wages deduction.
He was desperate for work and signed, he then realised he was working alongside other agency staff who worked for a reputable company who didn't do that.
He was not allowed to transfer to the other company.
So effectively on minimum wage after deduction for processing he was being paid 10% less than the minimum wage.
This is a con.  It does not take much skill to set up sage or some other pay software,  They are ripping the low paid off and need to be outlawed.

attributes.action: Reconsider blood donation guidelines affecting female partners of bisexual men
attributes.background:
Currently NHS blood donation excludes female partners of bisexual men from donating blood. 

You must not give blood or platelets for at least 3 months after sex
(If you are a woman) a man who has ever had oral or anal sex with another man, even if they used a condom or other protective.
attributes.additional_details:
This excludes women whose only long term partner is a man if their partner has ever had sex with another man. Despite this, a bisexual male partner can give blood if it has been 3 months since the last instance of sexual contact with a male. Exceptions may be made if the male partner is willing or able to attend an appointment as well.

This petition requests that guidelines be reconsidered to allow women who have had sex with men who have slept with other men but not in the past 6 months.

attributes.action: Make retailers to offer unpacking, packaging collection with home delivery items
attributes.background:
The amount of packages being delivered at homes, dispatched from big warehouses.
Excessive non recyclable packaging are damaged and end in landfills and stretches the capacity of local civic body. Collection of these materials by the retailer would encourage responsible packaging and recycling.

attributes.action: Require all CCGs to offer IVF for co-parenting parents
attributes.background: Clinical Commissioning Groups (CCGs) decide IVF policies. Despite NICE stating that “the existence of living children should not be a factor that precludes the provision of fertility treatment”, this guidance isn’t mandatory and the result is a postcode lottery.
attributes.additional_details: We have recently been refused IVF by our local CCG because we are co-parents. Make it fair so IVF is available on the NHS to all co-parenting parents!

attributes.action: Help end the scarcity of landlords who will accept the housing element of UC.
attributes.background: Removing a tenant's choice to have housing benefit paid directly to a landlord has meant that few landlords are prepared to house claimants. I fear this will continue (within UC) to contribute to homelessness for many and cause a number of deaths via exposure this winter.
attributes.additional_details: I completely understand the ethos behind encouraging those receiving benefits to take increasing levels of financial responsibility and to work towards independent living. However, the increased uncertainty for landlords caused by the freeze on LHA rates, and the strong preference towards the allowance being paid to the claimant, disadvantages vulnerable adults and leaves many trapped in addiction and homelessness. https://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/SN07008

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of plastic used in the KS2 SATs process.
attributes.background: Governors at our school were shocked when shown the amount of plastic not only used, but also thrown away during the administration of the KS2 SATs process.
attributes.additional_details: The amount of plastic used to keep the papers secure is largely unnecessary, added to which the number of bags within bags needed for the returns process is excessive, and contrary to the current public drive to reduce such waste.

attributes.action: Introduce a law to fit microchips in every ammunition round produced in the UK
attributes.background: With gun crime on the rise in the UK, it makes sense to try to detect those people carrying ammunition by means of a detection device worn by anyone with a reason to do so e.g. Police officers. A gun with no ammunition cannot kill.
attributes.additional_details: This will take time, but will reap benefits in years to come once existing stocks have depleted. This would need a small hand held device that could be worn by security officials that will send a vibrating alarm to the wearer and log the GPS location and serial numbers of all ammunition read by the microchips. The microchips would be similar to those used in dogs, only the size of a grain of rice. They would be inserted, by law into the gunpowder of every round made.

attributes.action: Allow Tattoos for 16 year olds with parental consent
attributes.background: Allow special tattoos for 16 year olds in meanings of birth, death and engagements e.g. 16.04.10 and scan photo or 16.04.10 to 28.02.64 and picture portrait.
attributes.additional_details: Allow memorable tattoos for 16 year olds.

attributes.action: One Island-One Member of Parliament -please keep our single MP for Isle of Wight
attributes.background:
10 September 2018
Commission's "final recommendations" to divide the Island to have 2 MPs. This is divisive. We need one MP to speak for all of us. One Island - one MP!

http://www.iwcp.co.uk/news/16832323.final-recommendations-for-isle-of-wight-parliamentary-constituencies-revealed/?ref=mr&lp=4
attributes.additional_details:
If you want one MP to support all of us as a united Island with one strong voice in Parliament, please support this petition. 

Thank you very much for your kind help.

attributes.action: Prohibit Domestic CCTV/motion/auto tracking cameras  protruding over boundaries
attributes.background: There is no strict law only guidelines relating to CCTV for domestic use to stop a persons CCTV from overlooking other people's property.  This law needs to be made firm in that no domestic CCTV should overlook and protrude into another person's property
attributes.additional_details: The guidelines are that CCTV should not overlook another persons property.  It can however go over the boundary of the property where it is installed.  The use of motion tracking/auto tracking cameras tobe restricted to use inside a domestic property and not positioned where they can track movement from anywhere outside the property they are installed.  The installation of such cameras over another persons property goes against the grain of the Human Rights Act and the Data Protection Act

attributes.action: Make St George’s day a national holiday in England
attributes.background:
Make St George’s day a national holiday in England
In Scotland, St. Andrew’s day is a holiday 
In Ireland, St. Patrick’s day is a holiday
Why if those countries have a holiday doesn’t England have one?

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for MPs to publish their tax returns.
attributes.background: If politicians are to govern the payment of tax, they should lead by example by making it mandatory to publish their tax returns publicly every year. Lead by example.

attributes.action: Make it optional to leave education at the age of 16.
attributes.background: Many young people are carers or need to support their family and they shouldn't be forced into staying in education as this restricts them from getting the income that they need. Britain's youth should not be held back because of the education system.
attributes.additional_details: You can have children and get married at the age of 16 but you can not leave education to get a job or to follow the career path that you want. The education system holds the youth back from getting what they truly want in life, education is not for everyone and therefore you should not be forced to carry on with it if you believe you are ready to leave. By the age of 16 you have enough knowledge to understand and know what you want for the future and for you.

attributes.action: Require social media sites to have warnings of flashing imagery/strobe lighting.
attributes.background: So often nowadays, people are going to parties and concerts and posting about it on social media which inevitably means that some content contains flashing imagery, however people with epilepsy and/or sensory issues are just opening up stories without a warning, which could bring on unease to them.
attributes.additional_details: If people are warned that a post contains flashing imagery, then it can make things so much easier for people with sensory issues and they then don't have to process all the flashing lights which can be overwhelming for many and so overall, including warnings on social media posts would definitely make sites such as Snapchat and instagram more accessible and friendly for many people, whether they suffer from epilepsy, sensory issues or simply find that flashing imagery can bring on anxiety.

attributes.action: Lower the speed limit on the A419, also put cameras on the road
attributes.background: I was involved in a serious car accident on the A419 that wasnt my fault. This was due to the speed in which the car behind me was driving, and did not have time to react. On this night 3 accidents, including mine happened. Accidents happen on this road daily and i think something needs to happen.
attributes.additional_details: You can see evidence on the Wiltshire Police accident. They are called out to accidents daily on the A419 I am sure they are tired of this.

attributes.action: Stop car insurers hiking premiums for 'non-fault'  or 'notification only' cases
attributes.background: I recently received my renewal invitation. They had hiked my premiums by nearly 3x. They told me that it was because I had notified them March last year that someone had smashed my windscreen. I did not make a claim. They had classed the notification as an 'at fault claim'. This needs to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
"Admiral is one insurer that bumps up premiums after just one non-fault accident. It claims it is justified in doing so because those involved in one are more likely to be involved in another accident later on. 

"By having a non-fault claim our customers fall into a category that we see as a higher risk to insure."

‘We rate on the fact an incident has occurred, whether they have claimed or not.’

Original article:
https://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/cars/article-3052191/How-drivers-insurance-costs-soar-no-fault-accidents-don-t-claim.html

It has to stop. The industry needs tighter regulations against this kind of profiteering, as that's what I, and a LOT of drivers see it as

attributes.action: Clarify the criteria for Secure Accommodation that is used by Local Authorities.
attributes.background: Secure accommodation should be used as a last resort and the Government should make this clear to Local Authorities in its guidance.

attributes.action: Open a public inquiry into the deaths at Gosport Memorial Hospital
attributes.background: The Gosport Independent Panel found over 450 lives were shortened due to the pattern of prescribing and administering of opioids. This deserves a public inquiry.
attributes.additional_details: BBC Panorama also investigated this.

attributes.action: Extend article 50 and call for a 'Citizen's Assembly' to resolve Brexit crisis
attributes.background: The Brexit debate has caused a deep societal divide in Britain which cannot be resolved by either pushing a 'no deal', 'no Brexit' or Teresa May's failed deal. A Citizen's Assembly, rather than a divisive second referendum, can heal this divide, but this needs time.
attributes.additional_details:
The time has come that the decision is given back to the people, not by a divisive second referendum but a healing, and unifying Citizen's Assembly.
A Citizen's Assembly worked very well in Ireland to heal the divide over abortion.

attributes.action: Change the Help to Buy rule of owning a property or share of one abroad.
attributes.background: My wife & I are British Citizens. Originally from abroad, we have family who still there. We are trying to buy a house through one the Government's Help-To-Buy Schemes but don't qualify because unfortunately my mother died and left me a share of her property in her will.
attributes.additional_details: The law of the country says I cannot give my share away to any of the heirs and trying to sell it to a third party individual is near impossible given the risks and future shared ownership with private individuals of the property. This continues to disqualify my family & I from the Help-To-Buy Schemes.

attributes.action: Make it a legal UK requirement that councils provide public toilets.
attributes.background: Throughout the UK, public toilets are closing. These actions are unfair on all sections of our society. It is a natural requirement to use toilets. It is illegal to defecate or urinate in the street so it should be a legal requirement to provide the facilities required to avoide breaking the law.
attributes.additional_details:
When the body needs to meet such needs, no amount of will power will over ride this no mater what the legal penalty is so what civilised country should put its citizens in such a position.

Councils should legally provide such services in all urban areas but should also not issue licences to any businesses selling refreshments if there are not toilet facilities available to its customers within say 100 meters of the business.

attributes.action: Stop people buying animals for Christmas then getting rid of them,
attributes.background: Anyone getting an animal should be made to have a licence, as well as the animal being chipped, 1,000 pound fine for anyone who decides to just dump there animal, or imprisonment. Also a 5,000 pound license for animal breaders and only 2 litters aloud. All puppy kittens to be chipped.

attributes.action: Refurbish immigration and trade ports for WTO brexit
attributes.background: The Government needs to invest in refurbishing immigration and trade facilities at ports for a WTO Brexit.

attributes.action: Lower the cost of university tuition fees.
attributes.background: We are starting to view universities that look great to us with the subjects we want to study but the tuition fees are a big factor and we’ve realised that they shouldn’t cost £9,250 so help us lower this and help more people attend university.

attributes.action: Give women 2 paid days off a month when needed during their time of the month.
attributes.background: Menstruation is bleeding that occurs when the uterus sheds its lining. Periods usually last from 2-7 days and can be light/heavy. Along with that women experience other symptoms such as back, neck and headaches, nausea, and diarrhea. Most women have to endure this whilst working and it's not right.
attributes.additional_details: Additionally more symptoms are migraines, stomachaches, and vomiting. Up to 20% of women experience extreme cramps at the onset of a period – a condition called dysmenorrhea. These cramps cause immense discomfort and pain, experiencing this at work affects productivity. Many women don't take sick days as it's something they know will come and simply cannot avoid unlike viral or bacterial illnesses almost all people experience. Other countries have adopted this and the UK should rightly follow suit.

attributes.action: Hold a Referendum on whether to give or not give foreign aid.
attributes.background: If 80% of voters in this referendum are in favour of NOT giving foreign aid, then foreign aid should be reduced by 80%, with similar action for any result.
attributes.additional_details: A great number of people are sickened and disgusted at a) The amount given away in Foreign Aid, and b) when that aid is given to unsuitable recipients. Foreign Aid should therefore be dependant on voters allowing it to be made by voting for it.

attributes.action: Make dog ownership/dog microchip details operate like car ownership.
attributes.background: Many people will have seen the cctv footage of a dog being abandoned on the side of a road in Trentham on 17/12/2018. The dog apparently had two previous owners but microchip details were not available of the current owner.
attributes.additional_details: It is a legal requirement in the UK that dogs of 8 weeks or over are microchipped and the details are updated but this clearly is not working with many dogs being identified with no updated microchip information. The government should make dog ownership similar to car ownership and V5C documentation. Therefore if you sold or transferred ownership to someone else it is the current owners responsibility to check and collect proof of name and address and send details to the microchip company.

attributes.action: Make all foreign lorry/hgv drivers carry insurance cards
attributes.background: To enter the uk, all lorry hgv drivers must carry a insurance card for the hgv they are driving, or a valid card from their employers, incase of a accident or incident, the card would have employment address and insurance details on, drive without one should fine the driver and take the hgv away
attributes.additional_details:
I was involved in a accident and it took the police 45 mins to get his details and his insurance how would the public who are shaken up get that information 
Even the police said good luck 
So a card with insurance address, policy number, name of the employer

attributes.action: Amend Royal Charter to stop BBC paying more than twice Prime Minister’s salary
attributes.background: The BBC is a public service and should not pay excessive salaries or other payments to individuals. Paying anyone over £1.5m a year to watch and comment on sport or present a 3 hour radio show is too much. Alternative talent could be found at lower salary levels.
attributes.additional_details: Publicly funded bodies have shown disregard for financial discipline and the BBC may be the worst. If commercial entities want to pay their staff excessive salaries and perks let their shareholders approve it or otherwise. The taxpayers are the BBC shareholders and I say enough is enough. who work primarily for the BBC should also pay tax and NI like everyone else at source. The talent will evolve to fill any gaps.

attributes.action: Sanitary products must become free of charge to all young women 18 or under.
attributes.background: Girls and young women are struggling to buy sanitary products for themselves which leaves them a unpleasant experience during their period. There are many young women living in poverty who can't provide for themselves so receiving free sanitary products would be beneficial.
